creator_comment_info: The number of comments on a post, including the post comments and replies to comments in the post
creator_fans_info: The number of followers gained through their posts
creator_fav_info: The number of times a post has been favorited
creator_homepage_visitor_info: The number of visits to a person's profile through their posts
creator_like_info: The number of likes on a post only includes likes received by the post itself, not the likes received by comments within the post
creator_post_data_bubble: You can click here to check out the details next time!
creator_views_info: The number of times a post has been viewed

data_center_desc: The current data update time is {date} (UTC+8).
data_dialog_tip:
1. The previous day's data will be updated daily at 10:00 (UTC+8). The data will be collected the day following the first publication of content.
2. The data represents historical cumulative amounts and changes from the previous day.
3. Data is offline and not updated in real time, and therefore may vary slightly from other data.

rights_detail_author_convention:
Dear Creator, thank you for your enthusiasm and passion for HoYoLAB. To maintain a healthy and harmonious environment, and nurture a space that encourages a creative experience, please read and understand the following guidelines for Creators:

I. About Creation Rules

HoYoLAB attaches great importance to the creative experience as well as the content environment. We ask you to abide by the following rules when creating:

1. Please do not post anything irrelevant to the corresponding game's section, category, or topic. Otherwise, you will receive a warning, and your post will be hidden from the corresponding category or topic.

2. Plagiarism, impersonating others while posting content, and other harmful behavior is strictly forbidden. Reported posts will be reviewed, and users found violating these rules will be permanently muted.

3. When posting previously published or copyrighted works, please obtain the consent of the author and credit the source. Otherwise, the post in question will be regarded as infringement. Infringing content will be removed unconditionally, and the infringing user will be warned and muted for two days.

4. When posting images, please select the "This is my original work" tag only if the work is originally created by you. If you want to republish an existing work, please make sure to disable the watermark feature before publishing. The process is as follows: click on your profile picture in the top-right corner, then choose Privacy Settings > disable "Add watermark when uploading images."

5. The following content is strictly prohibited: pornography, gambling, drug abuse, politics, all forms of extreme/hate speech, nudity, and disturbing images/emoticons/stickers. Posts with the above content will be removed and the authors of those posts will be muted for two days. Three consecutive violations will result in a permanent mute ban.

6. Be mindful of your cover choices to avoid misleading or upsetting other users. Violators will receive a warning and their covers will be hidden.

II. Concerning Discouraged Content:

As certified users of the community, Certified Creators should adhere to content quality guidelines.

The definition of uncreative content is as follows:

1. Content that is meaninglessly edited together with material from the internet

2. Content made by taking someone else's work and simply substituting some of the content

3. Content plagiarized/directly reposted from other people's works without naming the source

IIII. Your application for the certification title may be rejected or your certification title will be removed if the following occurs:

1. If other users report that you are not the real account holder or that you have impersonated celebrities or other creators to obtain the certified title, the HoYoLAB Community Team reserves the right to permanently revoke your certification or even ban your account.

2. The HoYoLAB Community Team will review account activity on our site. If there are data anomalies (including, but not limited to the number of likes and comments), the application for certification will be rejected.

3. If the majority of the account content contains unoriginal content, contains vulgar or low quality content, disseminates misinformation, contains illegal content, relates to war or other controversial topics, the application for certification will be rejected.

4. If, after successful certification, an account is reported by users to have breached the Forums Terms of Service, HoYoLAB Community Rules, or meet the criteria for the removal of certification in the Certified Creator standards, the certification privileges will be canceled and the title will be revoked. Banned accounts will not be able to obtain certification.

5. If an account that has been certified or is awaiting certification is set to private, or if the HoYoLAB account has not published any content, this account will not receive certification/have its certification removed.

IV. Relevant Creator Account Specifications:

1. Account Specifications

(1) The status of the Certified Creator account should be kept public. If a certified account changes its status to private, then its certification title will be canceled.

(2) The content and the account must comply with laws, regulations, the HoYoLAB Community Rules, and the account owner must have the ability to continuously create original quality content.

2. Nickname specification

(1) When applying for certification, an uncertified creator will be unable to obtain certification if their nickname contains the following content:

① Nicknames registered by individuals but clearly contain officially or politically sensitive information or statements, which can be easily mistaken as government agencies, organizations, etc., or nicknames with words that contain sensitive content such as pornographic words or curse words will not be approved for certification.

② Nicknames that impersonate others, including but not limited to other well-known creators and celebrities, etc. will not be approved. In this case, please change your nickname. Repeated malicious or spam applications will be permanently denied certification and the corresponding account may also be banned.

(2) Currently, creators' nicknames cannot be modified by themselves. If the Certified Creator nickname has violating content and needs to be modified, please contact us as contentcreator@hoyoverse.com to submit a nickname modification application.

V. Protection of personal information for Creators

HoYoLAB is working with you to protect your personal information. Protecting creators' personal information is one of our core principles. In the process of using HoYoLAB, we may collect your personal information (including but not limited to name, contact number, email address, etc.) in order to provide you with services and corresponding creator support. We will use security measures such as encrypted data transmissions and authorization rights management to protect your personal information. For more information on the protection of creators' personal information, please consult HoYoLAB's Privacy Policy.

We will continue to improve the Notice for Certified Creators and work with you to maintain a good creator community environment for HoYoLAB. Thank you once again for your understanding and support of HoYoLAB!
rights_detail_center_top:
Pinning Posts in Account Info — For Certified Creators

1. How do I pin my posts?

● The Pin Post function is still undergoing internal beta test and is only available for Certified Creators as an internal beta test benefit.

● Go to Account Info > Posts > Pin Post, where you can Pin your posts.

● You can only pin one post each time.
rights_detail_collection:
1. How do I create and manage my collection?

● The Collections function is still undergoing internal beta test and is only available for Certified Creators as an internal beta test benefit.

● Go to Account Info > Collections, where you may Create and Delete collections, etc. To create a collection, a title, a description, and a cover image are needed.

2. How do I add a post into my collection?

Method 1: Go to Collections > Post Management > Add Post. Select and add a new post.

● Selected posts will be added into the collection in the order of the selection. You may also adjust their order by holding the post in the Collections page.

Method 2: You may check and select Add to Collection when you publish a new post to put it into a relevant collection.

3. Notes on Creating Collections:

● Only your own posts can be added. Each post can only be added into one collection.

● TikTok video posts are not available to be added into a collection for now.

● Each collection can include a maximum of 200 posts.
rights_detail_official_digest: After becoming a Certified Creator, the content you create will be more easily seen by the official HoYoLAB team. It will also have more opportunities to be featured and recommended to other users, gaining rapid exposure and traffic. Popular content means content that is in the spotlight at HoYoLAB, which represents the popular trends of creations on the platform. HoYoLAB will continue to encourage the creation of ever more interesting and original content via displaying quality posts to give them more prominence. Posts that do not meet the requirements of the Creator's Agreement and relevant rules will not be selected as recommendations.
rights_detail_post_mgt:
1. How do I manage my posts?

Go to Account Info > Posts > More, where you may Edit and Delete your posts, etc.

2. Do edited posts have to be re-approved?

Yes. After you make changes to your post, it will have to be re-approved.
rights_detail_recommended:
Function Introduction

● After becoming a Certified Creator, your creations will enjoy more opportunities to be identified as quality recommendations and gain more exposure than regular content in prominent content sections such as the homepage.

● Being a Certified Creator can facilitate the growth of your account. To that end, create away on HoYoLAB!

Recommended Field

Note:

● Please note that not all submissions will receive large amounts of traffic exposure, only high-quality content with outstanding statistics will continue to receive more traffic exposure~
rights_detail_reply_mgt:
1. How do I manage my received comments?

Go to Account Info > Posts > All Comments > More, where you can Pin, Highlight, Report, Hide, and Blacklist the User for comments under your posts.

● The Highlight function is still undergoing internal beta test and is only available for Certified Creators as an internal beta test benefit.

● If you Highlight a comment, it will be marked with a Highlight tag. In each post, there can be up to 5 highlighted comments.

● If you Pin a comment, it will be exhibited on top of all comments in this post. In each post, there can be only 1 pinned comment.

If you encounter any difficulty while using these functions, please feel free to contact us via contentcreator@hoyoverse.com.
